tweets.text:
On #WorldRiversDay we have reports of #salmon leaping at #Shrewsbury weir.
It is early but flows and temperatures are good usually peak  is mid October
Salmon numbers are in decline please use #SpawningWatch for photos which helps us monitor the run  @severnrivers @LYR_Shropshire https://t.co/4gXCAQyAe4

tweets.text:
A very special visit last week from Marcus @MumfordAndSons to the #LakeDistrict river restoration projects delivered by @ullswatercic in partnership with @EnvAgency and @herdyshepherd. 

Our rivers are no longer a #HoplessWanderer ‚Ä¶ #IWillWait for a better pun. https://t.co/SpTSapbOsd

A big surge in rivers being adopted by pressure groups. If you know of an orphaned river take it under your wings. The good people at @AquiferChalk are creating a tool kit for you. We need more of you because the @EnvAgency under current senior management are useless.

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

There are approximately 240,600km of rivers and streams in England.

Read our blog on the work we do to deliver the protection and enhancement they need üëá

https://t.co/QLZ8HSZI35
LLL aka Lichfield Litter Legends collect 56 bags of rubbish at their Great British September Clean @KeepBritainTidy @stwater @EnvAgencyMids @CRTWestMidlands @LegendsLitter https://t.co/5iixuBtIj9

@EnvAgency #WorldRiversDay extraordinary to claim the rivers are improving & polluters are prosecuted under your management @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd this is the true picture of the state of the rivers 2018 Gaywood river tributary once a lovely Chalkstream üí©üíÄüêüüò± https://t.co/jIsanf5EbA

@EnvAgency Brazen Propaganda from a stooge agent of the government  ... we need honesty from @EnvAgencySW about the dreadful state of our rivers. @EnvAgency has presided over a terrible decline in water air and soil quality over the last 15 years @Feargal_Sharkey @StephenMoss_TV @SWTsteve

Looking at the replies to this it appears the truth is now out there.

The @EnvAgency are a ‚ÄúFailed and discredited organisation‚Äù. https://t.co/B2JJlcQ0hj

The changes to the sewage discharge permits in 2010 came via an appeal by @thameswater to the Planning Inspectorate. Shame on Thames for asking for them, shame on the Planning Inspectorate for upholding the appeal and shame on the @EnvAgency for accepting them without a whimper. https://t.co/kGu99tFYl4

tweets.text:
We also had an opportunity to talk of the Afternoon programme on BBC 3 Counties Radio yesterday. If you get chance have a listen it is 3hour 10mins 30secs into the programme. Not comfortable listening for the @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/8lYOfrhcrr

This #WorldRiversDay is more important than ever. Last week @EnvAgency figures revealed that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are classed as in good health. ZERO. 

It‚Äôs never been more crucial to support action for natures recovery üëâ https://t.co/zup3vrsuz7 #WilderFuture https://t.co/ll0pdflpI9

Happy #WorldRiversDay

#LIFEDeeRiver is an ambitious river restoration project to transform the river and its surroundings, to help improve declining fish populations and rare wildlife in the area.

The online launch is now available to watch again here: https://t.co/YhCmT7OLpH

#TeamEA are working with @ullswatercic @woodlandtrust local communities and @herdyshepherd to restore modified and straightened becks across the Ullswater catchment to boost wildlife, slow the flow and make more space for water @salforduniversity @aquauos

#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/Aw1MB6lW5M
@djsisson55 @RiverAndCoast @EastLindseyDC @EnvAgencyMids @robertcaudwell https://t.co/qLn0tbmRXn
Cold and blustery morning walk on the River Bank to see the desilting boat at work on the Steeping  @djsisson55 @EnvAgencyMids @NRobinsonEA @johncurtinEA @RiverAndCoast https://t.co/4T4Jl6k29z
@AquiferChalk @PJennings88 @EnvAgency I've reached out to Ian at Dorset County Council to find out the situation with the #Sydling Water, thanks

Good old @EnvAgency does it again. Missed its own performance target by nearly 25%.

Aim for 2019 - 20, "Enhance", 2,300 kilometres of rivers, lakes and coastal waters.

Result? Fail!

Question. What exactly do you mean by "enhanced"? How is that defined, who makes that decision? https://t.co/9x3KDtkqDj

A compelling and devastating round-up of the calamity facing England's rivers and the "Hotbed of mediocrity", that is the @EnvAgency.

Great stuff by @RachSalv https://t.co/d01T1Ts2Ft

Today as part of #WorldRiversDay we cleared an area below our new fish pass in #Kirkstall. Bringing in help from the @RiverStewards and @suttle_projects meant we could remove tyres and debris that have probably been there nearly five years. All improving habitat for wildlife https://t.co/j4Ni9nmz0S

Apply at https://t.co/HZ1Yb3DpFF  @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/PsHntjOjUv

Our beautiful rivers are in crisis. Recent @EnvAgency data showed none of England's rivers are in good overall health üò®
We're grateful to all our volunteers who dedicate time to helping our rivers, but we need more govt. regulation to combat this crisis #WorldRiversDay üëä https://t.co/6MZ0vxjiXq

Changes made in 2009 and 2010, do you think the changes increased the protection to rivers? no they did not, see below. Planning Inspectorate you are next! https://t.co/lW6f7f5gIM

tweets.text:
Sun 27th Sept is #WorldRiversDay A recent report from @EnvAgency showed only 14% of English Rivers are ecologically healthy.

Which is your local river? How could you get to know it better? What could you do to support it?

#ActsOfRiverKindness image: @jamesaldridge4 https://t.co/rKlUQOBnYy

tweets.text:
@suesustainable @AnnekaFrance @theriverstrust @Feargal_Sharkey @UnderwaterMedia @CleanIlkley @JohnnypalmerUk @SE_Rivers_Trust @sascampaigns @Sewagefreeswim @WindrushWasp @Ecohustler @wessexwater @FromeCouncil @FromeNubNews 4 days ago I saw a constant flow of water "with bits in" from roadside drain by the fountain next to Cheap St. Not sure if is sewerage, but not clean looking. 

Is it temporary due to roadworks or indicative of a burst main following into sewer? Little significant rain recently.

@EnvAgency How about backing  that up with data? Didn't every river in the country FAIL your chemical pollution tests? Get on with sorting that out for World River Day instead of this propaganda. @Feargal_Sharkey @thisisyourriver @Thames21 @LDNWaterkeeper
The latest River Steeping community newsletter https://t.co/VpfAC9j6lI

@suesustainable @jimkirkpatrick @AnnekaFrance @theriverstrust @Feargal_Sharkey @UnderwaterMedia @JohnnypalmerUk @SE_Rivers_Trust @sascampaigns @Sewagefreeswim @WindrushWasp @Ecohustler @wessexwater @FromeCouncil @FromeNubNews Do report to the @EnvAgency incident hotline

urls.title: State of bathing waters
urls.description: Bathing water monitoring by country. Please note: for the scales 1:5.000.001 and less detailed, data are aggregated by country. In such case, stacked bars show percentage of bathing water quality for coastal and inland waters together. Number of bathing waters within certain category is seen in pop up window which can be turned on with a click on one of the countries. For the scale range 1:5 000.000 to 1:700,001, individual bathing water sites (points) are visible instead of classified stacked charts and are coloured according to the classification of bathing water quality. Symbol size depends on the map scale (in more detailed map scales symbols are bigger). For the scales 1:700,000 and more detailed, symbol of bather in a square appears instead of points. Symbol size depends on the map scale.

tweets.text: State of bathing waters. UK vs other European countries. @EnvAgency turning blind eye to inland water quality. Who would believe it? #pollution @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/JShgtSTLY9 via @EUEnvironment
@EnvAgency No you don't. The evidence puts your incompetence under the spotlight. Stop sending out propaganda and start prosecuting the offenders. Get some teeth.
@EnvAgency You could start by stopping water companies from dumping raw sewage in them and then move on to excessive abstraction from our chalk streams

@EnvAgency How many of those incidents could you have stopped happening in the first place if you simply enforced existing regulations? Axe that huge tranche of mid-high management and get more people back on the ground. Act as a regulator not some weak industry conscience.

To celebrate #WorldRiversDay #TeamEA are highlighting our work in partnership with @EdenRiversTrust & @networkrail in Thrimby An 800m channel realignment project that will not only provide benefits to fish and other wildlife but also reduce flood risk to the West Coast Main Line. https://t.co/FwwebMtf9o
